Package chess.model

Class Position

java.lang.Object
chess.model.Position
public final class Position extends Object
A class that represents a position in the chessboard, defined by:
  1. a file letter, the horizontal position, represented by an integer index in the range [1, 8];
  2. a rank number, the vertical position, an integer in the range [1, 8].
This class defines all operations associated with positions.

  • Constructor Details

    • Position

      public Position(int file, int rank)
      Constructs a Position object from a file index and a rank number.
      Parameters:
      file - The integer file index of the position in the range [1, 8].
      rank - The integer rank number of the position in the range [1, 8].
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the given file index or rank number is out of the range.

    • Position

      public Position(String file, int rank)
      Constructs a Position object from a file letter and a rank number.
      Parameters:
      file - The file letter of the position as a single-letter string (case-insensitive).
      It should be one of files.
      rank - The integer rank number of the position in the range [1, 8].
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - Rethrown from Position(int, int).
      IllegalArgumentException - If the given file string is invalid.

  • Method Details

    • at

      public static Position at(String notation)
      A convenient method to create a Position object using string notation, which is of the pattern "^[a-h][1-8]$".
      Parameters:
      notation - A two-character string notation that describes a valid position in the chessboard, matching "^[a-h][1-8]$".
      Returns:
      A Position object.
      Throws:
      FormatException - If the notation is invalid, i.e. does not match the pattern.

    • copy

      public Position copy()
      Returns:
      A deep copy of this Position object.

    • moveTo

      public void moveTo(int file, int rank)
      Moves this position to the given file index and rank number.
      Parameters:
      file - The integer file index of the new position in the range [1, 8].
      rank - The integer rank number of the new position in the range [1, 8].
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the given file index or rank number is out of range.

    • left

      public Optional<Position> left(int deltaFile, Colored colored)
      Returns a new position that is a number of squares to the left of this position from the given colored object's point of view.
      Parameters:
      deltaFile - The integer number of squares to step in the range [-7, 7].
      colored - The colored object of the POV.
      Returns:
      An optional new Position object, which is empty if the new position is outside the chessboard.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If colored is null.

    • left

      public Optional<Position> left(int deltaFile)
      Returns a new position that is a number of squares to the left of this position from White's point of view, the default POV of the chessboard setup.
      Parameters:
      deltaFile - The integer number of squares to step in the range [-7, 7].
      Returns:
      An optional new Position object, which is empty if the new position is outside the chessboard.

    • axialStep

      public Optional<Position> axialStep(int delta, int quadrant, Colored colored)
      Returns a new position that is a number of steps away from this position in one of the following directions: 
                  Q2 (maxY)
                │
                │
 Q3 (minX) ─────┼───── Q1 (maxX)
                │
                │
            Q4 (minY)
      The directions in which the steps may take with respect to the origin (i.e. the current position) are referred to as quadrants, as labeled above. The four quadrants, independently, are as follows: 
       ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧    ‧ ‧ x ‧ ‧    ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧    ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧
 ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧    ‧ ‧ x ‧ ‧    ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧    ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧
 ‧ ‧ @ x x    ‧ ‧ @ ‧ ‧    x x @ ‧ ‧    ‧ ‧ @ ‧ ‧
 ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧    ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧    ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧    ‧ ‧ x ‧ ‧
 ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧    ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧    ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧    ‧ ‧ x ‧ ‧
    Q1          Q2          Q3          Q4
      Parameters:
      delta - The number of steps away from this position.
      quadrant - An integer ranging from 1-4 representing the quadrant (direction) of this axial movement.
      colored - The colored object of the POV.
      Returns:
      An optional new Position object, which is empty if the new position is outside the chessboard.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If quadrant is invalid.
      NullPointerException - If colored is null.

    • axialStep

      public Optional<Position> axialStep(int delta, int quadrant)
      Returns a new position that is a number of steps away from this position in one of the four directions set out in axialStep(int, int, Colored), with respect to White's point of view, the default POV of the chessboard setup.
      Parameters:
      delta - The number of steps away from this position.
      quadrant - An integer ranging from 1-4 representing the quadrant (direction) of this axial movement.
      Returns:
      An optional new Position object, which is empty if the new position is outside the chessboard.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If quadrant is invalid.

    • radialStep

      public Optional<Position> radialStep(int deltaFile, int deltaRank, int quadrant, Colored colored)
      Returns a new position that is a number of steps away from this position in any linear path that lies on or in-between the X and Y axes of a 2D Cartesian plane: 
              Y
        │
     Q2 │ Q1
 X ─────┼───── X
     Q3 │ Q4
        │
        Y
      For example, here is a group of linear paths that each lie in a different quadrant: 
       ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧ x    x ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧    ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧    ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧
 ‧ ‧ ‧ x ‧    ‧ x ‧ ‧ ‧    ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧    ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧
 ‧ ‧ @ ‧ ‧    ‧ ‧ @ ‧ ‧    ‧ ‧ @ ‧ ‧    ‧ ‧ @ ‧ ‧
 ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧    ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧    ‧ x ‧ ‧ ‧    ‧ ‧ ‧ x ‧
 ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧    ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧    x ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧    ‧ ‧ ‧ ‧ x
    Q1          Q2          Q3          Q4
      Parameters:
      deltaFile - The number of horizontal steps away from this position.
      deltaRank - The number of vertical steps away from this position.
      quadrant - An integer ranging from 1-4 representing the quadrant in which the linear path resides.
      colored - The colored object of the POV.
      Returns:
      An optional new Position object, which is empty if the new position is outside the chessboard.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If quadrant is invalid.
      NullPointerException - If colored is null.

    • radialStep

      public Optional<Position> radialStep(int deltaFile, int deltaRank, int quadrant)
      Returns a new position that is a number of steps away from this position in any linear path that lies on or in-between the X and Y axes of a 2D Cartesian plane, with respect to White's point of view, the default POV of the chessboard setup.
      Parameters:
      deltaFile - The number of horizontal steps away from this position.
      deltaRank - The number of vertical steps away from this position.
      quadrant - An integer ranging from 1-4 representing the quadrant in which the linear path resides.
      Returns:
      An optional new Position object, which is empty if the new position is outside the chessboard.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If quadrant is invalid.

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object object)
      Two positions are considered equal if and only if both positions are equal in their file index and rank number.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      object - The position to compare to.
      Returns:
      A boolean value indicating whether this position is equal to the given position.

    • atLastRank

      public boolean atLastRank(Color color)
      The last rank is 8 for White and 1 for Black.
      Parameters:
      color - The color of the POV.
      Returns:
      A boolean value indicating whether this position is at the last rank in the given color's point of view.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If color is null.

    • getSquareColor

      public Color getSquareColor()
      Returns:
      The color of the square at this position.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      The two-character string notation of this position that matches the regex pattern "^[a-h][1-8]$".
